home.headline: WireGuard® VPN Portal
home.abstract: WireGuard® is an extremely simple yet fast and modern VPN that utilizes state-of-the-art cryptography. It aims to be faster, simpler, leaner, and more useful than IPsec, while avoiding the massive headache. It intends to be considerably more performant than OpenVPN.

installation.headline: Installation
installation.content: Installation instructions for client software can be found on the official WireGuard website.

about-wg.headline: About
about-wg.content: WireGuard® is an extremely simple yet fast and modern VPN that utilizes state-of-the-art cryptography.

about-portal.headline: WireGuard Portal
about-portal.content: WireGuard Portal is a simple, web based configuration portal for WireGuard.

profiles.headline: VPN Profiles
profiles.abstract: You can access and download your personal VPN configurations via your Userprofile.
profiles.content: To find all your configured profiles click on the button below.

admin.headline: Administration Area
admin.abstract: In the administration area you can manage WireGuard peers and the server interface as well as users that are allowed to log in to the WireGuard Portal.

no-interface.headline: No interfaces found...
no-interface.abstract: Click the plus button above to create a new WireGuard interface.

no-peer.headline: No peers available
no-peer.abstract: Currently, there are no peers available for the selected WireGuard interface.

no-user.headline: No users available
no-user.abstract: Currently, there are no users registered with WireGuard Portal.

no-peer.headline: No peers available
no-peer.abstract: Currently, there are no peers associated with your user profile.

settings.headline: Settings
settings.abstract: Here you can change your personal settings.

api.headline: API Settings
api.abstract: Here you can configure the RESTful API settings.
api.active-description: The API is currently active for your user account. All API requests are authenticated with Basic Auth. Use the following credentials for authentication.
api.inactive-description: The API is currently inactive. Press the button below to activate it.
api.button-disable-title: Disable API, this will invalidate the current token.
api.button-enable-title: Enable API, this will generate a new token.

webauthn.headline: Passkey Settings
webauthn.abstract: Passkeys are a modern way to authenticate users without the need for passwords. They are stored securely in your browser and can be used to log in to the WireGuard Portal.
webauthn.active-description: At least one passkey is currently active for your user account.
webauthn.inactive-description: No passkeys are currently registered for your user account. Press the button below to register a new passkey.

modal-delete.headline: Delete Passkey
modal-delete.abstract: Are you sure you want to delete this passkey? You will not be able to log in with this passkey anymore.

webauthn.button-save-text: Save the new name of the passkey.
webauthn.button-cancel-text: Cancel the renaming of the passkey.
webauthn.button-delete-text: Delete the passkey. You will not be able to log in with this passkey anymore.
webauthn.button-register-text: Register a new Passkey to secure your account.

audit.headline: Audit Log
audit.abstract: Here you can find the audit log of all actions performed in the WireGuard Portal.

no-entries.headline: No log entries available
no-entries.abstract: Currently, there are no audit logs recorded.

keygen.headline: WireGuard Key Generator
keygen.abstract: Generate a new WireGuard keys. The keys are generated in your local browser and are never sent to the server.

password.label: Password
password.description: Leave this field blank to keep current password.
password.too-weak: The password is too weak. Please use a stronger password.

disabled.label: Disabled (no WireGuard connection and no login possible)

locked.label: Locked (no login possible, WireGuard connections still work)

display-name.label: Display Name
display-name.placeholder: The descriptive name for the interface

dns.label: DNS Server
dns.placeholder: The DNS servers that should be used

firewall-mark.label: Firewall Mark
firewall-mark.placeholder: Firewall mark that is applied to outgoing traffic. (0 = automatic)

routing-table.label: Routing Table
routing-table.description: Special cases: off = do not manage routes, 0 = automatic

pre-up.label: Pre-Up
pre-up.placeholder: One or multiple bash commands separated by ;

post-up.label: Post-Up
post-up.placeholder: One or multiple bash commands separated by ;

pre-down.label: Pre-Down
pre-down.placeholder: One or multiple bash commands separated by ;

post-down.label: Post-Down
post-down.placeholder: One or multiple bash commands separated by ;

endpoint.label: Endpoint Address
endpoint.description: The endpoint address that peers will connect to. (e.g. wg.example.com or wg.example.com:51820)

networks.label: IP Networks
networks.description: Peers will get IP addresses from those subnets.

display-name.label: Display Name
display-name.placeholder: The descriptive name for the peer

linked-user.label: Linked User
linked-user.placeholder: The user account which owns this peer

private-key.label: Private Key
private-key.help: The private key is stored securely on the server. If the user already holds a copy, you may omit this field. The server still functions exclusively with the peer’s public key.

endpoint-public-key.label: Endpoint public Key
endpoint-public-key.placeholder: The public key of the remote endpoint

endpoint.label: Endpoint Address
endpoint.placeholder: The address of the remote endpoint

extra-allowed-ip.label: Extra allowed IP Addresses
extra-allowed-ip.description: Those IP's will be added on the remote WireGuard interface as allowed IP's.

dns.label: DNS Server
dns.placeholder: The DNS servers that should be used

pre-up.label: Pre-Up
pre-up.placeholder: One or multiple bash commands separated by ;

post-up.label: Post-Up
post-up.placeholder: One or multiple bash commands separated by ;

pre-down.label: Pre-Down
pre-down.placeholder: One or multiple bash commands separated by ;

post-down.label: Post-Down
post-down.placeholder: One or multiple bash commands separated by ;

identifiers.label: User Identifiers
identifiers.description: A user identifier (the username) for which a peer should be created.

prefix.label: Display Name Prefix
prefix.description: A prefix that is added to the peers display name.
